text:
A gracefull stop and start results in the following message:

[Wed Apr 09 11:57:14 2003] [warn] pid file /www/logs/httpd.pid overwritten --
Unclean shutdown of previous Apache run?

OS: Linux 2.4.18 (Conectiva Linux)
Apache: 2.0.45
GCC: 2.95.3

The file httpd.pid was not clear or killed, after Apache stops!

[root@desenvolvimento logs]# ls -l
total 2
-rw-rw-r--    1 root     root          119 Abr  9 11:57 error_log
-rw-r--r--    1 root     root            6 Abr  9 11:57 httpd.pid
[root@desenvolvimento logs]#
creator: ranier@cultura.com.br
trawick@apache.org
text:
What is "graceful stop and start"?

Can you show which apachectl commands (and how much time in-between) you used to
reproduce this problem?

Any messages in the error log or in the terminal used to invoke apachectl?

I'm sorry. This is not a bug.
The log occur because the "start" is executed by gdb:

gdb /www/bin/httpd
run -X -f /www/conf/httpd-debug.conf

and the "stop":
/www/bin/apachectl stop

The file httpd.pid are still open by the gdb.
And the httpd don't close httpd.pid correctly.

When tests with:
/www/bin/apachectl start
and
/www/bin/apachectl stop

All is ok!

I ask for excuses for my mistake!
creator: ranier@cultura.com.br
